content: page 6 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com putting it all together all the pieces laid out together sew the head to the body by sewing each stitch in the head to each stitch in the body they should line up perfectly sew on each arm just below the neck i make them just a little forward of where a human shoulder would be page 7 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com i put his cape on next because it dawned on me that the tie around the neck was smaller than his head i slipped it from his body to his neck not over the head sew the legs on between the 4th and 5th row from the center bottom beginning row i do the arms first so i can see where the middle of the body is going to be then start stitching the leg next i put on the tail at the back of the body with the bottom of the tail at the 5th row from the center bottom the tail should assumedly cover part of the back seam but it doesn t usually work out that way page 8 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com start sewing the inner edge of the ear on the head at the 2nd row from the center then extending outwards to do the face i used blue 4 ply yarn i cut a long piece separate it into 2 strands and use that to make a face i like to make my eyes like an x over a single_crochet stitch be careful not to do it over an increase you ll get wonky looking eyes the nose is a triangle you can also use embroidery thread or make the face out of felt and sew it on with sewing thread page 9 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com more pics of the finished bunny have fun page 10 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com
